system.description:
Giant demons that have eaten a large number of other demons, festering and growing in their self-serving atrocity. Usually takes the form of humanoids, but can take on the form of giant boars, crocodiles, serpents, monitor lizards, and the like. Frequently travels around with a colossal weapon: a pillar from a palace, a bell from a temple, a giant hammer from a dead god.

(The stats provided here is for a Rank 1 encounter. Check the book for higher ranks.)
system.attacks:
Inflict Violence: Ashra Pillar. Attack all enemies in an area (Line 3) with Bravery.

Gambits [[/r d4]]

1: Rush > Inflict Violence > Inflict Violence

2: Rush > Inflict Violence > Devil Halo [1]: Taunt all enemies in blast 4 until they hit the Ogre Demon.

3: Rush > Narka Aura [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (burst 1) with Bravery, setting aflame.

4: Rush > Devil Beast Madness [2]: Attack all enemies in an area (burst 2) with Bravery. If done while Staggered, add +Faith to the attack. Stun one adjacent enemy.

traits.name: Fester
traits.description: At the start of Resound 2+, all demons fester: their unique trait triggers and they gain +1d to all attacks until the end of the Resound. They fester every start of Resound afterwards.

traits.name: Atrocious Residue
traits.description: When a Demon is Defeated, they discorporate and roll 1 Attack Die on all enemies in the battlefield. Unless the battlefield is purified or cleansed by proper rituals, they will rise again after eighty seven days.

traits.name: Violent Devil God
traits.description: At the start of a Resound, if there are exactly 3 demons left in the battlefield, they may combine into a Violent Devil God: choose one demon as the main body. Add all remaining HP together, and the main body gains +1 to all Prowesses and becomes Size 3.

traits.name: Antigod
traits.description: All demons are vulnerable to anything that might sear away corruption and darkness.

traits.name: Devil Tiger
traits.description: The Ogre is Size 2. Whenever a demon is Defeated in the battlefield, the Ogre heals 1. When the Ogre Festers, they gain Block 2.
